data.message:
Tonight, we PLAY! Come celebrate our 10th anniversary serenading the fine people of the Upper West Side at Winter's Eve at Lincoln Square. We're doing three sets between 6 and 9pm along Broadway between Columbus Circle and 65th Street. Come one, come all!

6:00-6:45pm: we parade along Broadway.

7:15-7:45pm: we boogie at the dance tent on the 61st between Broadway and Columbus.

From 8:30-9:00pm, we're at the Main Stage at Dante Park: Broadway between 63rd & 64th Streets.

Yes! 

http://www.winterseve.org
data.name: Winter's Eve at Lincoln Square | 12.1.14
data.caption: winterseve.org

data.message: Thank you !  (We're still hungry, no matter how much turkey and stuffing we eat!)
When I'm done with school I want to come home and make a "Hungry" feast for everyone!

data.message: Thanks to everyone who came out to the Halloween Parade with the HMB last night--dancers, spotters, crazy costumers, to Rob Olesky for driving and letting us bungee cord and tape decorations to his car, and of course, the band! You all made a great "Greenhouse of Doom!"

Our drummer David is in the middle of a 6 week tour with his other band, O'Death. After finishing a show in L.A. on 10/30, they were robbed. Their van, trailer, gear, instruments, tons of merchandise, and most of their personal belongings were stolen... Now they are stranded at some hotel without anything to finish the tour. It is great to see how all of their fans and supporters are pitching in to help... anything you can give will help them finish their tour and make their way home somehow... This is a member of our band- our community- in a very upsetting circumstance!
data.name: Click here to support o'death: band robbed of all assetts by David Rogers-Berry
data.caption: www.gofundme.com
data.description: Hi Friends, Our band, O'DEATH, was robbed outside of Los Angeles after our show at The Echo on Oct 30. Our van and trailer were stolen, and along with it, all of our equipment, instruments, personal belongings, and merchandise, including hundreds of units of our new album and all of our other re...

data.message: please share widely.
Donated.  Love, March Madness Marching Band

Speaking for O'DEATH, we really appreciate the support from this wonderful community. 
-David Rogers-Berry

data.story: Hungry March Band added a new photo.
data.name: HMB Halloween Parade
Tamborile. Festival de Música de Calle de Mezquita de Jarque

data.message:
Hi All,
Forwarding this info from Matthew Fass for Halloween parade tonight, if you are marching with us. Just a few points: there is a possible rain prediction at the END of parade--about 10 PM, so be ready. You can layer up and leave your coats and umbrellas in Rob Olesky's car for the parade.

I will be there with said car from about 5 PM on, and will bring my giant bags of props and flair-we have toadstools, spiders, roses, cactus plants, a black owl, and a couple strings of leaves still available. I have some makeup, and will be happy to help you apply it if necessary, though that isn't my forte. You may want to bring your own makeup in case we run out. If you want to use the props we're bringing, please try to get there by 6 PM. If any problems come up, remember my cell is 646-727-6693, so text me. If you need to email me to get a performer pass, email me at emly.fairey@gmail.com before 3 PM. Look forward to seeing you there,
best, 
Emily

LINEUP INFORMATION
Your group: Hungry March Band
Has been put in the line-up at Inner Roadway Ghost C
Your recommended arrival time: By 5:00 pm for drop off and parade vehicles and by 5:30 pm for those arriving on foot. http://bit.ly/aVfLuc

Your performers and guests can come to the corner of Dominick & Varick Streets and say "Hi, I'm with Hungry March Band" and they will be allowed to enter the staging area. From there, they can ask any parade marshal in an official shirt how to get to Inner Roadway Ghost C. 

ENTRANCE TO STAGING AREA
Performer entrance BEFORE 5:30 pm: Any direction
Performer entrance AFTER 5:30 pm: Dominick & Varick Streets http://bit.ly/aVfLuc

EXPRESS ENTRY
Because it can get very hectic in the parade between 5:30 pm and the start of the parade at 7:00 pm, we're using performer passes again this year to help your group members get to their lineup area. Please forward the performer pass that I sent to you last week and ask your performers to bring a copy of it on their phone or print it out and bring it with them to the parade staging area. Let me know if you need me to send these again to you.

PLEASE READ
Do take a look at the maps and instructions I sent a few days back and make sure you understand where you're meeting your group. 

CONTACTING ME AT THE PARADE
It becomes very noisy at the parade as group start to lineup and I can't answer the phone after 5:30, so please send me a TEXT to 917-497-7852 and clearly state who you are, what group you're from and how I can help you.

FAQ
http://halloween-nyc-music.com/faq/ - please read

DRESS FOR THE WEATHER!
As of today, there's a chance of rain on Friday night, so please dress accordingly. The parade goes on, rain or shine, as stated in your agreement, so please be prepared for anything.

SEE YOU ON HALLOWEEN!
Feel free to contact me if you have any questions. And don't forget to check-in your group at the corner of Broome and Sixth Avenue so we know you've arrived. Or send me a TEXT at 917-497-7852 to let me know that you're arrived to your lineup area.

Matthew Fass
Music Director
NYC Village Halloween Parade
917-497-7852
halloween.nyc.music@gmail.com
http://www.halloween-nyc.com/
http://www.halloween-nyc-music.com/

--Please forward this email to your entire group.---

data.message: Exact Location of tonight's practice for Halloween dancers: McCarren Park at corner of Driggs and Lorimer--come learn some dances and get some costume points!
Mayday Marching Band is doing much the same!

ATTN: Come out TONIGHT to learn a few of our dances for the Halloween Parade. Tonight, Wed., Oct. 29, 7p at McCarren Park. Check back for exact location. All are welcome! No dance experience necessary.

See below for costuming info for the parade itself!
data.story: Hungry March Band shared Emily Fairey's photo.
data.name: Photos of Hungry March Band
data.caption:
Come join the Hungry March Band for our 15th year participating in the
West Village Halloween Parade. Our theme this year, fitting in with the
overall parade theme of the "Garden of Earthly Delights" is the "Greenhouse
of Doom." Populated by Zombie Flowers, Toadstools, Skeleton Tomatoes, Unholy Hemp, Naughty Vines, Vampire Roses, Carnivorous Herbs, Grass-skinned demons, Animal-vegetable hybrids, Fly-Traps of the Infernal Venus, Apple Trees of the Evil Queens, and the dragons that guard them. Any plant life--or Unlife-- is welcome...along with devilish gardeners, killer bees, and Noxious Weed Killers! Color bases of Green, Gold and Silver, but all colors are Glorious and Scary! The Greenhouse of Doom is lush, inviting, and beautiful, but watch out! don't eat anything...or you will be eaten!

data.message: McCarren Park at corner of Driggs and Lorimer

data.message: Pure Joy!  Why can't we do this all the time??
Hey cuties!
Jill, you are having toooo much fun
c'mon is there such a thing?!
Absolutely bogus concept.
Thank you, New York City, for an amazing week! xoxo HMB
Tonight we PLAY. $10 tickets available online today through 5pm at www.honknyc.com on the events page. This will be an amazing show you do not want to miss. xxx HMB xxx
data.story: Hungry March Band shared HONK NYC's event.

data.message: TONIGHT: Hungry March Band plays HONK NYC's Friday Night Gala. $10 pre-sale tickets available until 5pm at www.honknyc.com. $15 at the door. This is an amazing line up of 9 bands you don't want to miss:  Chaotic Noise Marching Corps, Batala New York City, Muses tanguent, Radio Kaizman, underground horns, SPANGLISH FLY, Environmental Encroachment and DjaRARA.

data.message: TONIGHT: HONK NYC Opening Night Dance Party at Littlefield with our friends: Raya Brass Band, Muses tanguent, PaKaVa It', Frank London, and PitchBlak Brass Band. Don't miss this feast for your ears, eyes, and feet!
data.name: HONK NYC! Opening Night Dance Party - Tickets - Littlefield - Brooklyn, NY - October 15th, 2014
data.caption: www.littlefieldnyc.com
data.description: The 2014 HONK NYC! Festival opening night concert features global brass music presented by artists from NYC, Moscow and Paris. Famed NYC-based trumpeter Frank London headlines and welcomes acts Pakava

data.message: HONK NYC today at 5:30pm at One Penn Plaza with Radio Kaizman! Meet our new friends from Lyon, FR. Awesome hip-hop/funk/jazz sounds await you. They won 3rd place in a festival in which HMB participated with them last summer in Dole, FR. Woot! Free show.
data.name: Radio Kaizman
data.caption: www.radiokaizman.com
data.description: Présentation de Radio Kaizman, fanfare groove / hip-hop / jazz brass band. Profondément inspiré des sonorités urbaines, du groove et des rythmes typiques des marching bands New Orleans, ponctué de swing et d'influences latine.

data.message: Wish I could make it!
